title: Cardinal number
summary: In mathematics, cardinal numbers, or cardinals for short, are a generalization of the natural numbers used to measure the cardinality (size) of sets. The cardinality of a finite set is a natural number: the number of elements in the set. The transfinite cardinal numbers, often denoted using the Hebrew symbol â„µ {\displaystyle \aleph } (aleph) followed by a subscript, describe the sizes of infinite sets.
